verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician<WH5329> on Neginoth,<WH5058> Maschil,<WH4905> A Psalm of David.<WH1732> Give ear<WH238> to my prayer,<WH8605> O God;<WH430> and hide<WH5956> not yourself from my supplication.<WH8467>
Attend<WH7181> to me, and hear<WH6030> me: I mourn<WH7300> in my complaint,<WH7879> and make a noise;<WH1949>

Because of the voice<WH6963> of the enemy,<WH341> because<WH6440> of the oppression<WH6125> of the wicked:<WH7563> for they cast<WH4131> iniquity<WH205> on me, and in wrath<WH639> they hate<WH7852> me.
My heart<WH3820> is sore pained<WH2342> within<WH7130> me: and the terrors<WH367> of death<WH4194> are fallen<WH5307> on me.
Fearfulness<WH3374> and trembling<WH7460> are come<WH935> on me, and horror<WH6427> has overwhelmed<WH3680> me.
And I said,<WH559> Oh that I had wings<WH83> like a dove!<WH3123> for then would I fly<WH5774> away, and be at rest.<WH7931>
See,<WH2009> then would I wander<WH5074> far<WH7368> off, and remain<WH3885> in the wilderness.<WH4057> Selah.<WH5542>
I would hasten<WH2363> my escape<WH4655> from the windy<WH7307> storm<WH5584> and tempest.<WH5591>
Destroy,<WH1104> O Lord,<WH136> and divide<WH6385> their tongues:<WH3956> for I have seen<WH7200> violence<WH2555> and strife<WH7379> in the city.<WH5892>
Day<WH3119> and night<WH3915> they go<WH5437> about<WH5437> it on the walls<WH2346> thereof: mischief<WH205> also and sorrow<WH5999> are in the middle<WH7130> of it.
Wickedness<WH1942> is in the middle<WH7130> thereof: deceit<WH8496> and guile<WH4820> depart<WH4185> not from her streets.<WH7339>

For it was not an enemy<WH341> that reproached<WH2778> me; then I could have borne<WH5375> it: neither<WH3808> was it he that hated<WH8130> me that did magnify<WH1431> himself against<WH5921> me; then I would have hid<WH5641> myself from him:
But it was you, a man<WH582> my equal,<WH6187> my guide,<WH441> and my acquaintance.<WH3045>
We took sweet<WH4985> counsel<WH5475> together,<WH3162> and walked<WH1980> to the house<WH1004> of God<WH430> in company.<WH7285>
Let death<WH4194> seize<WH3451> on them, and let them go<WH3381> down<WH3381> quick<WH2416> into hell:<WH7585> for wickedness<WH7451> is in their dwellings,<WH4033> and among<WH7130> them.
As for me, I will call<WH7121> on God;<WH430> and the LORD<WH3068> shall save<WH3467> me.
Evening,<WH6153> and morning,<WH1242> and at noon,<WH6672> will I pray,<WH7878> and cry<WH1993> aloud:<WH1993> and he shall hear<WH8085> my voice.<WH6963>
He has delivered<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> in peace<WH7965> from the battle<WH7128> that was against me: for there were many<WH7227> with me.

God<WH410> shall hear,<WH8085> and afflict<WH6031> them, even he that stays<WH3427> of old.<WH6924> Selah.<WH5542> Because<WH834> they have no<WH369> changes,<WH2487> therefore they fear<WH3372> not God.<WH430>
He has put<WH7971> forth<WH7971> his hands<WH3027> against such as be at peace<WH7965> with him: he has broken<WH2490> his covenant.<WH1285>

The words of his mouth<WH6310> were smoother<WH2505> than butter,<WH4260> but war<WH7128> was in his heart:<WH3820> his words<WH1697> were softer<WH7401> than oil,<WH8081> yet were they drawn<WH6609> swords.<WH6609>
Cast<WH7993> your burden<WH3053> on the LORD,<WH3068> and he shall sustain<WH3557> you: he shall never<WH3808> <WH5769> suffer<WH5414> the righteous<WH6662> to be moved.<WH4131>

But you, O God,<WH430> shall bring<WH3381> them down<WH3381> into the pit<WH875> of destruction:<WH7845> bloody<WH1818> and deceitful<WH4820> men<WH582> shall not live out half<WH2673> their days;<WH3117> but I will trust<WH982> in you.
